reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Clever Near Future Parable
reviews.reviewText: This is a fun and smart read. A bit of a parable about freedom and how we volunteer to give freedom for safety and pleasure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fast moving, futuristic police procedural
reviews.reviewText: In the future, America finds a way to solve most problems of unhappiness, boredom, and criminal activity. Virtual reality and brain implants seem to control impulses or let the impulses fly in an imaginary space, keeping people safe. However, some crimes still happen. Mind Burn by T. E. Bakutis and Rhett C. Bruno is the story of two futuristic detectives who utilize advanced tech methods to solve those crimes to which they are assigned. I loved this “Law and Order” set many years from now and the special characters within it. The novel is voiced in the point of view of several different characters, but mostly by the two detectives who are partners on their first case. The writing is descriptive, as it should be in a highly detailed technological situation. You do not have to be an IT grad to read this book, the science is well explained. However it flows at a great pace, keeping the reader engaged. As clues stop surfacing on one case, another crime happens, making the partners seem realistically overworked and real. The Mission Impossible type ending is a bit long and explosive but does tie up the crime. Mind Burn is a science fiction police procedural with great world building including laws and government offices so different from today. I am hoping that a series begins with all the crew, brain augmentation and relationships created in this novel. I suggest for those who like Blake Crouch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a great book and wrap-up!
reviews.reviewText: Mind Burn is a science fiction police procedural with great world building! It has enough twisty turns to keep you guessing all the way through the book! In case that's not enough it'll make you want to learn how to be an IT coder without having to figure out what's goin on and skipping all the classroom histrionics... it absolutely breaks down what's happening in layman's terms.And Man. Ohhhh Man that ending!!! I did not that! You could've knocked me down with a feather!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exciting and intriguing
reviews.reviewText: Wow! This story takes place in a future where people have their emotions tied into a device in their brains! Meant to keep crime, assaults and murders under control, this should be a beautiful world, but , as usual, something is turning people into killing machines. Cowan and Jeb are tasked with investigating cybercrimes. This takes them on a journey through human brains and cyberspace! Great read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Scfi noir at its best
reviews.reviewText: I was given an advance copy of this book, for the purpose of seeing if I would provide a cover blurb. The novel blew me away. It reads like the heir to DO ANDROIDS DREAM OF ELECTRIC SHEEP, with updated futurism based on the massive technological changes we've witnessed since that book came out 55 years ago. I hope Bruno and Bakutis write a sequel.
A good story without a bunch of hanging threads. Well written. Enjoyed the story. Interesting balance of characters. Nicely wrapped up.

I have always been fascinated with cyberpunk, especially since I played the Shadowrun games. I have tried various books including classics like Neuromancer but never enjoyed them because the writing just wasn't good enough in my opinion.The writers generally use too much unnecessary jargon and deliberate obfuscation.This was different. This was outstanding, easy to follow, gripping from the first page and exhilarating from start to finish.It was everything I could ask from the genre or any book to be honest.I think I've discovered 2 new favorite authors.What an excellent book to start a new year!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wow!If you like non stop action, twists and turns in a world which seems frighteningly possible, this is the book for you!
